item.title: [ANY] Java Plugin System
item.dc:creator: @blackflag1 blackflag_
item.description:
@blackflag1 wrote:

Davidi2:

You guys realize you are just as bad for talking about it after it’s over right?

both is bad ok

[quote=“Davidi2, post:30, topic:540709”]@ OP - For a real plugin system to work you need to have a more generic system as well. Specifically:
[tt]public static final List buttonPlugin = new LinkedList();[/tt]

Look into interfaces and abstraction and such.[/quote]

wouldn’t it be better do do something like
[tt]public static final List plugins = new LinkedList();[/tt]

public interface Plugin { }

so that way you could make multiple plugins that just doesn’t handle one thing?
(just using this as an example)

idk

Read full topic

item.title: [ANY] Java Plugin System
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

You guys realize you are just as bad for talking about it after it’s over right? The ‘argument’ was only like 5 sentences and the rest was actual conventions discussion, more than we can say about all of your mongering posts. It did get escalated a little bit more than it needed to but it wasn’t that bad. Anything else past this will get deleted.

@ OP - For a real plugin system to work you need to have a more generic system as well. Specifically:
[tt]public static final List buttonPlugin = new LinkedList();[/tt]

Look into interfaces and abstraction and such.

Read full topic

item.title: [ANY] Java Plugin System
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:22, topic:540709”]I like how you can assume that I was “skirting” my way around it when the way I worded my post was an honest mistake.[/quote]What exactly was the point of your post if it wasn’t to try and call me out? OP already had [tt]/* … */[/tt] comments in his code in addition to the ones I was pointing out so there was no reason to ‘add that on’. But whatever, doesn’t matter now.

[quote=“Rodgerwilco, post:23, topic:540709”]Davidi2, you can customize your IDE to automatically have any default comment. I don’t see why you’re complaining unless you’re going to use it… which I know you won’t.[/quote]Yes you’re right I’m not going to use the code but people should still try and meet conventions if they are going to release code so we try to be as educational as possible, hence why I’ve told him what the conventions are rather than only complaining about his comments.

EDIT - speaking of which I forgot to link the convention page when I quoted it
http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/documentation/codeconventions-141999.html#385

Just be careful when you read it, make sure you read the whole thing before coming to any conclusions.

Oh, another important part:

Note:The frequency of comments sometimes reflects poor quality of code. When you feel compelled to add a comment, consider rewriting the code to make it clearer.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:

Davidi2, you can customize your IDE to automatically have any default comment. I don’t see why you’re complaining unless you’re going to use it… which I know you won’t.

You said ‘correct according to convention’, which implied my way was incorrect. That was your mistake and you tried to skirt around it after re-reading the documentation. But yea, @OP:

I like how you can assume that I was “skirting” my way around it when the way I worded my post was an honest mistake.

item.title: [ANY] Java Plugin System
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

You said ‘correct according to convention’, which implied my way was incorrect. That was your mistake and you tried to skirt around it after re-reading the documentation. But yea, @OP:

The // comment delimiter can comment out a complete line or only a partial line. It shouldn't be used on consecutive multiple lines for text comments; however, it can be used in consecutive multiple lines for commenting out sections of code. Examples of all three styles follow: [code=java] if (foo > 1) { 
    // Do a double-flip.
    ...
}
else {
    return false;          // Explain why here.
}
//if (bar > 1) {
//
//    // Do a triple-flip.
//    ...
//}
//else {
//    return false;
//}[/code]</blockquote>

Read full topic

item.title: [ANY] Java Plugin System
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:19, topic:540709”][quote author=AtomicInt_ link=topic=659573.msg4410865#msg4410865 date=1393609281]

Thats a javadoc comment, so yes it does matter. // vs /* */ doesnt matter though if its on one line according to the oracle conventions, which is why I found it funny atomic tried to correct me

you clearly can’t read
[/quote]you clearly can’t own up to your mistakes, and instead act like a pussy[/quote]

I did own up to my mistake?

Read full topic

item.title: [ANY] Java Plugin System
item.dc:creator: @Michael_P1 Michael P
item.description:
@Michael_P1 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:16, topic:540709”][quote author=xx matty xx link=topic=659573.msg4410859#msg4410859 date=1393608226]
Yes, it’s wrong. If you have a single line comment just use /* */ or //. What on earth would possess you to use a 3-line comment block for one line?
[/quote]Valid javadoc format would be one reason, but that wouldn’t be inside the method

Also worth noting a lot of the comments in this code are absolutely useless. Things that are defined by someone reading the code (ie: List names) dont need comments (/* a list of the names as strings */) unless you provide extra detail[/quote]

Alright thanks. When I get some time I will update the method with proper conventions.

Read full topic

item.title: [ANY] Java Plugin System
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:15, topic:540709”]Yes, it’s wrong. If you have a single line comment just use /* */ or //. What on earth would possess you to use a 3-line comment block for one line?[/quote]Valid javadoc format would be one reason, but that wouldn’t be inside the method

Also worth noting a lot of the comments in this code are absolutely useless. Things that are defined by someone reading the code (ie: List names) dont need comments (/* a list of the names as strings */) unless you provide extra detail

Read full topic

item.title: [ANY] Java Plugin System
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Yea that’s wrong.
/*
*/
(on multiple lines) should only be used to define methods and such (but to be better you honestly should just add the extra * and make it valid javadoc comments), and inside methods you shouldn’t use that

Read full topic

item.title: [ANY] Java Plugin System
item.dc:creator: @Michael_P1 Michael P
item.description:
@Michael_P1 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:7, topic:540709”][quote author=Michael P link=topic=659573.msg4410836#msg4410836 date=1393599323]

Jesus christ if you have 1 line comments use //

single line comments according to convention are “/* comment */”

@op; I wrote something similar awhile ago: https://github.com/atomicint/script/

Ah, so I was correct then?
[/quote]No, you have:
/*

  • We loop through our loaded files and packages and add them to our listing.
    */

Vs
/* We loop through our loaded files and packages and add them to our listing. */
or // we loop …

[quote author=AtomicInt_ link=topic=659573.msg4410805#msg4410805 date=1393577266]

Jesus christ if you have 1 line comments use //

single line comments according to convention are “/* comment */”

@op; I wrote something similar awhile ago: https://github.com/atomicint/script/
[/quote]No, single line comments can use [tt]/* comment */ [/tt]or [tt]// comment [/tt]‘according to convention’. Read the whole convention page before trying to look smart kthx[/quote]

I use /* comment */ when doing a single line of code (in a method body) and:

/*
*
*/

when doing a statement ( in a method body). If I’m wrong, please correct me.

Read full topic

item.title: [ANY] Java Plugin System
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2

Thats a javadoc comment, so yes it does matter. // vs /* */ doesnt matter though if its on one line according to the oracle conventions, which is why I found it funny atomic tried to correct me

item.title: [ANY] Java Plugin System
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

Davidi2:

No, single line comments can use [tt]/* comment */ [/tt]or [tt]// comment [/tt]‘according to convention’. Read the whole convention page before trying to look smart kthx

I didn’t state that it was the only way to write single-line comments, my post was misleading as I implied [tt]/* comment */[/tt] was the only correct way to make a single-line comment I meant to add on to your post.
